ON THE BRIDGE:

> <OLD>
>
> Quickstride gives a somewhat relieved smile, an=
d looks to Wing Caliber,
with a short sigh.
>
> "Thanks, that cuts a lot of=
 pause time out that's for sure. Okay, like you
said, carefully, and simult=
aniously. I've done that before several times,
but it's been a while since =
I had ta do this last."
>
> He takes the tools given to him by Wing Caliber=
, and carefully, he follows
his instructions to a T with surpsingly good de=
xterity and with an extremely
delicate and stable hand.
>
> "Ohh I hope tha=
t works.."

<NEW>

Even with Quickstride=92s dexterity it is no easy task t=
o line up the leads
for cutting.

=931 minute to final detonation!=94 The b=
ridge computer announced.

Carefully he is able to line up the first . . .
=

=9350 seconds to final detonation!=94 The computer said again, apparently =
it was
more frequent as the last minute counted out.

. . . and then the se=
cond . . .

=9340 seconds to final detonation!=94 The computer=92s tone was=
 calm as it spoke
of the destruction that appeared to be imminent.

. . . t=
he third one is a bit more difficult . . .

=9330 seconds to final detonati=
on!=94 Another intonation.

. . . but the last seemed almost impossible to =
clasp. It was as if the tool
was too small for the task!

=9320 seconds to =
final detonation!=94

With a slight nudge it finally slipped into place, an=
d with a simple
activation the bypass is clipped.

=9310 seconds to final d=
etonation!=94 There was a cold finality in the
computer=92s words. Should t=
he bomb go off, it would mean destruction not only
of the Ark but the futur=
e and past of everyone there.

=939 . . . 8 . . .=94

=93QUICK!=94 Wing Cal=
iber hissed the urgency in his voice almost palatable, =93CUT
THE MAIN LEAD=
S!=94


IN THE COMPUTER ROOM

> <OLD>
>
> Perceptor continued to working tr=
ying to turn off the ark=92s Shields and
> running at same time the Ark=92s=
 scanners looking for any thing that isnt
all
> right for Decepticons and A=
utobots that were inside the ark while he said
> =93Any other thing that I =
have to know??=94

<NEW>

Legacy shook his head, his single optic and the g=
lowing bar on his chest
providing the only illumination in the room. =93You=
 know enough to complete
your task.=94 Legacy=92s words were cold and witho=
ut rancor.

A message came in from Tuscon . . .

> "Legacy, this is Tucson =
Prime.. I am going to emit a sonar wave at full
> magnitude. It will disrup=
t the enemy programming and give you a window
> of opportunity to take back=
 the programming of our systems. At that time,
> I need you to commence rec=
onfiguration, as it will be very easy to regain
> full control of the syste=
m. "

=93Understood.=94 Legacy intoned, =93Be aware that at the magnitude I=
 project you
are about to use, our own systems may be compromised as well.=
=94

Legacy glanced over at Perceptor but continued to speak to Tuscon via =
radio,
=93However both Perceptor and I are in the control room, and stand r=
eady to
minimize the damage as much as possible.=94

ELSEWHERE IN THE ARK:
=

> <OLD>
>
> Elita breathed with relief, she never had been soo scared in h=
er short
life =93I=92m here=94said aloud with her childish voice =93Be care=
full he just
Vanish... I dotn know where he is=94
>
>
> In another part of =
the Ark, Uproar transforms into his beast mode and
bounds in to find no sig=
n of the intruder anywhere. He growls angrilly.
>
> "GRRRR! That rotten sla=
g ball got away!"
>
> His expressions change quickly upon finding Elita. A =
gentile look comes
over his face, as he crouches down to check her over, to=
 be sure she hadn't
been injured in any way.
>
> "Don't worry little cat, a=
s long as we're here, that mean slag ball pred
isn't gonna lay another fing=
er on ya. And if he does, he's had it."
>
> He turns to Leo ll
>
> "Sir, I'=
d like to be Elita's body guard until we figure out how ta catch
and stop t=
hat slag ball."
>
> He puts a protective paw around Elita, gently holding h=
er against his
massive body.
>
> " No ugly slag pred's gonna try that scrap=
 on you while I'm around, I
promise."
>
> Elita cudle against Leo II and sa=
id "He told me that he will come back for
> me and that we will talk at leg=
ht... I couldt stop him... he almost got
me"
>
> The little one lowered her=
 ears in sadness.

<NEW>

As Elita cuddled up on Uproar, Leo II looked arou=
nd, his optics sharp and
his ears flicking a bit. =93GRRRR=94 he said, it c=
oming out like a deep throated
roar/purr. =93You will have to speak with Ro=
dimus about being her guardian.=94

Leo padded over to the area that the in=
truder had been standing and sniffed,
his face uneasy, =93I don=92t like th=
is. We don=92t know if the intruder can turn
invisible, or teleport.=94 he =
said, grumbling. =93Or both.=94

He glanced up as Rodimus and Ramulus came =
running down the halls towards
them!

Rodimus almost skidded to a halt, his=
 sharp optics easily picking out Elita,
his chest mounted headlights flicki=
ng on to illuminate the dead end they
were all standing in. =93Elita, you a=
lright?!?=94 he said as he looked over at
her, concern for her etched in hi=
s face.


<NEW>

Meanwhile, a few halls away the intruder, squatting in the=
 halls gets a
message . . .
 > <OLD>
>
> =93When you are ready to leave, to=
ld me, I=92ll create a distraction=94said cold

> Hydras =93IF YOU HARM A D=
ECEPTICON IN THE ARK YOU WILL REGRET IT, DO YOU
> UNDERSTAND???=94

<NEW>

=
The intruder looked down at the heavily damaged form of Lord Elder and
smil=
ed, =93But of course I hear you.=94 He said quietly to Hydras. He looked
do=
wn at a timer on his wrist and nodded, =93Begin your distraction; it is tim=
e
for me to leave.=94

MEANWHILE BACK OUTSIDE:

> <OLD>
>
> Outside the Ark=
, Tucson did not like the idea that his comrades and his
home were being co=
mpromised by the Predacon forces. He knew something had to
be done, and did=
 not care what condition he was in. For now, Rat Trap had
stopped the leaki=
ng of battery fluid, and for this moment, with the regular
flow of fluid ba=
ck into his system, he could at least transform into his
robot mode, with j=
ust a bit of pain from his injurred arm.
>
> " Torca, thank you for your he=
lp, I appreciate it deeply. Now, it's my
turn to contribute to the cause. T=
he only way we'll be able to regain
control of the Ark, is if we throw off =
a disrupter wave, that will cancel
out enemy programming. I am now capable =
of doing so since we are at such
close range."
>
> He narrows his optics da=
ngerously. This meant he was fully prepared to do
whatever it took to regai=
n the Ark's control.
>
>
> Night Shift transforms and prepares to back up h=
is commander.
>
> " This is gonna work, I know it will."
>
> Tucson then tr=
ansmits to Rodimus.
>
> "Rodimus, as full control of the Ark is re establis=
hed, it will be your
> opportunity to head a clean sweep of the Ark entirel=
y. That means any
enemy
> forces that are still present, will be yours for =
the capture. But do not
> destroy. Anyone you find, will be valuable for qu=
estioning. Once captured,
> they're to be brought to the questioning room, =
where I will personally
> question them myself. Good luck comrade."

<NEW>
=

Rodimus responded, =93Gotcha. We=92ll be ready.=94


> <OLD>
>
> His expre=
ssion turns resolute as he now stands solidly with a firm foot on
the groun=
d. He begins to transmit the most powerful sonar wave ever emitted
by his s=
ystems.
>
> "Legacy, I'm transmitting now. Be prepared. Leo ll, I'll need y=
ou to head
> another scouring team on the outer parameter of the Ark. No do=
ubt if there
> are any enemy forces that have escaped, they may still be wi=
thin range of
> capture. Take the south parameter and extend your search as=
 widely as you
see
> fit. Noctorro, I will need you to head a group of Maxi=
mals to scour the
North
> Parameter outside the Ark's boundaries. The furth=
er we go, the better our
> chances are at capturing enemy intruders. Night =
Shift, I want you to go
with
> Kup, and scour the East Paramater. Talon, Wi=
ndlord, Rat Trap, you will
take
> the West Parameter. Go as far as all of y=
ou see fit, but safely within
range.
> It's our only assurance of securing =
our base from further attack."

<NEW>

Leagcy responded, =93Understood. Shu=
tting down shield now.=94 He said. The
reason behind this maneuver was obvi=
ous, if he did not, the shield would
more than likely repel most if not all=
 of Tuscon=92s blast wave.

At the same time each of the Maximals gave thei=
r assent to Tuscon and go off
in different directions. It was time to clean=
 up the area around the Ark,
and make sure there were not other surprises w=
aiting for them.

Meanwhile Tuscon began his wave assault! Like a tidal wav=
e constructed of
ultrasonic sound the blast began to roll over the Ark, the=
 very air
shimmering in its path.

Inside the Ark different systems began t=
o spark as the energy quickly
overloaded delicate systems. Legacy quickly a=
ttempted to reroute power, but
even he was not entirely successful.

On the=
 bridge several systems shorted causing other back up systems to kick
into =
place. All over the Ark, power that had been previously shut off turned
bac=
k on flooding the Ark with lights once again . . . and then sending parts
o=
f it back into darkness as circuit breakers blew.

=93FRELL!=94 The intrude=
r barked as he shimmered for a moment, his cloaking
device temporarily shor=
ted by Tuscon=92s blast. He looked up, but at the
moment there was no one n=
ear him, the other Maximals having caught up with
the little femme bot were=
 a few hallways away.

With the skill of a master ninja he stepped into the=
 shadows as he pulled
out his blades.

MEANWHILE NEAR HYDRAS:

Scourge knee=
led down next to Hydras, as all the sweeps were doing to keep
the lead Pred=
acon hidden from the sensor beams from the Ark.

=93ACK!=94 Scourge said as=
 he watched Tuscon fire his beam at the Ark, =93That
must of hurt!=94 He co=
uld see the power moving over the Ark.

One of the Sweeps nudged Scourge an=
d pointed at two Maximals approaching
their position, it was Nightshift and=
 Kup. If that got much closer their
cover would be blown!

A message came f=
rom Nighrazor, =93Whatever you=92re going to do Hydras you had
better do it=
 now, the bots are waking up.=94

(TAG)

Preston
